text: Antigen receptor regulated signalling pathways in PKD - null DT40 B cells
To further explore the contribution of PKD kinases to DT40 B cell biology we investigated whether specific BCR - regulated signalling events were defective in the PKD - null B cells .

Initial experiments revealed that surface expression of the BCR was reduced in <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - ( and in <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - : Flag - <extra_id_0> PKD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + ve ) cells compared to wild-type DT40 B cells ( Fig . 3A and data not shown ) .

Nevertheless , BCR-crosslinking of <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - cells was sufficient to induce the activation of a number of signalling cascades , similar to that observed in wild-type cells ( Fig . 3B ) .

Hence , BCR - induced activation of the <extra_id_0> Akt <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> mTOR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / p70 S6 kinase ( as shown by <extra_id_0> S6 ribosomal protein <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation ) and MAPK signalling pathways was clearly detectable in <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - null B cells ( Fig . 3B ) .

text: Furthermore , enhanced tyrosine phosphorylation of multiple cellular proteins as well as an increase in intracellular calcium levels was also observed following BCR stimulation of <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - null B cells ( data not shown ) .

We did observe that the strength of BCR ( but not phorbol ester ) - induced regulation of the <extra_id_0> Erk1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> RSK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signalling pathway was reduced in <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - B cells compared to wild-type B cells ( Fig . 3B ) .
One interpretation of this data is that PKD enzymes may modulate Erk activation .
Indeed , PKD enzymes have previously been linked to the growth factor - regulated Erk signalling in fibroblast and endothelial cell lines [ 33-35 ] .

However , BCR - induced Erk phosphorylation was also reduced in <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / -- Flag - <extra_id_0> PKD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + B cells ( data not shown ) suggesting that reduced BCR levels on the surface of <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - ( and <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / -- Flag - <extra_id_0> PKD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + ) B cells may itself impact on the strength of activation of this specific intracellular signalling pathway .

To search for other potential PKD targets that may show defective regulation in <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - DT40 B cells , we used a PKD substrate phospho - antibody that recognises consensus phosphorylation sequences targeted by PKD enzymes ( LxRxxpS / T ) [ 36 ] .

As shown in Fig . 3C , phorbol ester - and BCR - induced phosphorylation of cellular substrates detected by this phospho - antibody was similar in wild-type and <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - cells and is therefore independent of PKD enzymes .

However , pretreatment of both wild-type and <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - DT40 B cells with GF109203X , a bisindoylmaleimide derivative that inhibits PKCs prevented the induction of proteins that contain phosphorylated LxRxxS / T motifs .

Thus loss of <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> enzymes does not globally disrupt the phosphorylation of cellular proteins that contain LxRxxpS / T motifs .

text: This result is perhaps not surprising as LxRxxS / T motifs also act as good substrates for other serine / threonine kinases such as <extra_id_0> MAPKAPK2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
However these experiments do provide further evidence that phosphospecific antisera are not sufficiently selective to be designated kinase specific substrate antisera .
BCR - induced signalling pathways culminate in the activation of gene transcription events that control B cell survival , proliferation and function .
In this context , it has been proposed that PKD family members control of gene transcription through activation of the NFkappaB transcription factor .

Thus , PKD - mediated activation of NFkappaB occurs downstream of a variety of different signals , including mROS / oxidative stress , lysophosphatidic acid and the <extra_id_0> Bcr-Abl oncogene <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 17 , 21 , 23 , 30 , 37 ] .

Furthermore , expression of an activated <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutant enhances <extra_id_0> HPK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated NFkappaB activation [ 38 ] .

text: In B cells , NFkappaB is known to be regulated via DAG and <extra_id_0> PKCbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 39 , 40 ] but whether PKDs are key intermediaries for NFkappaB regulation has not been explored .

The data ( Fig . 4A ) show that NFkappaB transcriptional activity was strongly induced in both wild-type and <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - DT40 B cells in response to either phorbol ester or BCR stimulation .

In contrast , BCR and phorbol ester - induced NFkappaB transcriptional activity was abolished in <extra_id_0> PKCbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - DT40 B cells ( Fig . 4A ) , although strong activation of PKD kinases ( as assessed by autophosphorylation of <extra_id_0> PKD1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> at S916 ) was observed in the <extra_id_0> PKCbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - cells ( Fig . 4B ) .

text: Thus , PKD kinases are neither essential nor sufficient to mediate BCR - induced NFkappaB activation in DT40 B cells and hence do not participate in DAG / PKC mediated control of NFkappaB .
